repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.abstract: This collection documents Larry D. Struve's efforts to reconnect the members of the Tufts Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy Class of 1965, and details their reflections on their time at Fletcher, as well as their accomplishments after graduating.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Larry D. Struve, 2017, accession number MS-2017-041.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Correspondence in Box 1 arranged alphabetically; original order maintained throughout collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Larry D. Struve was born in Los Angeles, California in 1942. He received a Bachelor's degree from the University of Nevada in 1964, a Master of Arts from the Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy at Tufts University in 1965, and a Juris Doctor from the University of California, Berkeley in 1968. He then worked in Nevada as a law clerk and as part of a law firm before becoming the Chief Deputy District Attorney for the State of Nevada, Carson City from 1975—1978, and the Chief Deputy Attorney General for the State of Nevada, Carson City from 1979—1982. From 1983-1993, Struve served as the Director of the Nevada Department of Commerce, and since 1993 he has served as the Chief of Industrial Development.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Larry D. Struve Papers, 1995-2017. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Leah Edelman in March 2017. Materials were placed in archival boxes if the original housing was damaged, and loose materials were placed in folders where needed. Received order was maintained. A box-level inventory and series-level description were created and a finding aid was created.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Larry D. Struve graduated from the Tufts Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy in 1965. His papers document his efforts to reconnect members of this class and to publish a memoir book, titled "In the Shadow of Camelot," detailing their reflections on their time at Fletcher, as well as their accomplishments after graduating. This collection includes correspondence; Fletcher publications and reunion materials; photographs; drafts and promotional, production, and research material related to "In the Shadow of Camelot;" and material related to the establishment of the Fletcher School's Camelot Legacy Scholarship by the class of 1965.

Box 1 contains correspondence with classmates to gather information eventually published in class newsletters and "In the Shadow of Camelot," as well as a draft introduction to the book. Box 2 contains the 18 editions of Fletcher ClassNotes 1965, a publication used to share information and encourage attendance at the Class of 1965's 30th, 35th, and 40th reunions; as well as photographs of and correspondence with classmates about these reunions; and a binder presented to Assistant Dean Chuck Shane at the 35th reunion in 2000.

Box 3 contains correspondence pertaining to the 40th and 50th class reunions; material related to the production and promotion of "In the Shadow of Camelot," including drafts of text, a CD of songs quoted in the book, and books by Fletcher classmates; and correspondence regarding the Fletcher School's Camelot Legacy Scholarship, funded by the Class of 1965 in 2016.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish.
Any intellectual property rights that the donor possesses have not been transferred to Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence, Fletcher ClassNotes, Reunion materials, photographs, books and manuscripts, and materials relating to the establishment of the Camelot Legacy Scholarship.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series is open for research.
